Knurl.title: Burning The Surface
Knurl.about: Divided into three parts, this release was originally recorded as one entire track.

Knurl.title: Indicative of the Existence
Knurl.about: These tracks were recorded live using a “wired” car spring as sound source. No overdubs, loopers, mixing, or editing were used.
Knurl.credits:
released May 28, 2025
            
            Cover art is an 8”x10” acrylic on canvas painting by Alan Bloor, and is available in merch. Only one is available. Shipping is included in price. Includes unlimited streaming of Indicative of the Existence via the free Bandcamp app, plus high-quality download in MP3, FLAC and more.

Knurl.title: The Final Decisive Moment
Knurl.about: Originally released by Oxen in 2022.
Knurl.credits: released June 18, 2025

Knurl.title: Affinity For Disaster
Knurl.about: All pieces were recorded live using a car spring wired with guitar strings. It was scraped, beaten, and bowed with chains, metal rods, angle iron, and a violin bow.
Knurl.credits: released May 1, 2025

released December 1, 2022
            
            Produced and recorded live by Alan Bloor using scrap metal as sound source.

Knurl.title: A Discrete Entity
Knurl.about: These tracks were originally going to be used for The New Blockaders/Knurl split LP. Due to levels which they were recorded, mastering them for vinyl would have been detrimental to the sound, so I’m releasing them here. Other tracks have been recorded for the split to replace these.
Knurl.credits:
released April 1, 2023
            
            Produced and recorded live by Alan Bloor, June 24, 2022.

Knurl.title: A Scathing Attack
Knurl.credits: released August 15, 2023

Knurl.title: 6SP
Knurl.about:
All pieces produced and recorded live by Alan Bloor, June 1, 2020, using cement trowels, chains, and a violin bow.

No post production, or overdubbing.
Knurl.credits: released May 4, 2023

Knurl.title: Knurl at No Music Fest.
Knurl.about:
These tracks are the live Knurl performance at the No Music Festival held in London, Ontario at The Aeolian Hall, March 27, 1998.

Special thanks to The Nihilist Spasm Band, Ben Portis (RIP), Tim Glasgow, and Jason Bellchamber. Also special thanks to Jason “Soddy” Kushnir for helping me connect to festival organizer Ben Portis.
Knurl.credits:
released April 3, 2022
            
            Recording engineers: Jason Bellchamber and Tim Glasgow, assisted by Josef Turner.

Edited, mixed, and mastered by Tim Glasgow.

Knurl.title: Floritura Deuteranopia
Knurl.about: This was originally released as a cdr on the Self Abuse sub-label Solipsism in 1998. The original release had no track titles.
Knurl.credits:
released June 5, 2022
            
            Produced and recorded live by Alan Bloor, using various scrap metal as sound source.

Knurl.title: Chainmeal I + II
Knurl.about: Chainmeal I + II was originally self-released in 1995. This has since been remastered by Alan Bloor.
Knurl.credits:
released August 19, 2022
            
            These two tracks were produced and recorded live by Alan Bloor, February 5, 1995, using chains on scrap metal as sound source.

Knurl.title: Torus
Knurl.about: This was originally released by alien8recordings in 1999, as a cd-r, with a limit of 100 units. All tracks were recorded live, and scrap metal was used as sound source.
Knurl.credits:
released April 12, 2022
            
            Produced, recorded, and re-mastered by Alan Bloor, Apr. 12, 2022.

Knurl.title: Tetramatrix
Knurl.about: These tracks have been re-mastered, and were originally released on cassette in 1994 by Panta Rhei Recordings. Original track titles have been misplaced.
Knurl.credits:
released October 9, 2022
            
            All pieces were recorded live by Alan Bloor using found metal.

Knurl.title: Acidamide
Knurl.about: This was originally released as a cdr in 2005 by Harshnoise.
Knurl.credits:
released November 4, 2022
            
            All pieces produced and recorded live by Alan Bloor.

Knurl.title: The Needed Stimulus
Knurl.about: All pieces produced and recorded live by Alan Bloor using various scrap metal as sound source. No computers or overdubs.
Knurl.credits: released July 8, 2022

Knurl.title: The Unintentional Process
Knurl.about: Matters To Be Acted On, and Comparative Variation were originally one track that I split up because the change in the latter part of the track was so different, that it sounded like a completely different piece. This split track, (the two pieces) were recorded in 2016. Derive As A Conclusion was recorded in 2022 as a practice session for a couple of shows I was doing in Toronto, and Montreal on August 6, and 13 2022, respectively.
Knurl.credits:
released August 31, 2022
            
            Produced and recorded live by Alan Bloor using a “wired” car spring on tracks 1+2, and a pavement saw blade, threaded rod, washers, cement trowel, hand file, and violin bow on track 2.

Knurl.title: Halometh
Knurl.about: Halometh was originally released as a pro-pressed cdr by Cohort Records in 2010.
Knurl.credits:
released July 28, 2022
            
            All pieces produced and recorded live by Alan Bloor using scrap metal as sound source. Special thanks to John Gore for releasing this.

Knurl.title: The Inciting Cause
Knurl.about: These tracks were recorded live on March 27 2022 using a cement trowel, chain, 1 1/4” stainless steel pipe, and a piece of glass 12”X12”.
Knurl.credits:
released March 27, 2022
            
            Produced and recorded live by Alan Bloor. 

Cover photo by Alan Bloor.

released December 11, 2020

Knurl.title: Nervescrap
Knurl.about: These tracks are from the original Nervescrap master tape. The release is over 100 mins. in length, and was recorded on Dec. 31, 1994, and Jan. 2, 1995, using a small electric fan and bass guitar as sound source.
Knurl.credits:
released March 23, 2021
            
            Produced and recorded live by Alan Bloor in Montreal, Quebec.

Knurl.title: Outside Diameter Payoff
Knurl.about: Recorded March 18 2021 using various saw blades as sound source.
Knurl.credits:
released April 24, 2021
            
            Produced and recorded by Alan Bloor.

Knurl.title: Periodic Nephromucilaginosity
Knurl.credits: released January 11, 2022

Knurl.title: Meatrag
Knurl.about: The Meatrag release was originally a C90 cassette, and was released in early 1995. Sounds were recorded straight to cassette using a Sony Walkman headphone speaker as a microphone with a Boss distortion, DOD equalizer, Morley Wah, and a Boss digital delay. These tracks were slightly enhanced through a Berringer mixer, but are true to the original cassette master. Sounds were produced using a small electric fan and a bass guitar.
Knurl.credits:
released March 9, 2021
            
            Recorded live by Alan Bloor January 1995 in Montreal.

Knurl.title: The Tide of Unreason
Knurl.about:
These pieces were recorded during a rehearsal for my Dual Abrasives performance at NAISA on August 31 2019. This was a performance in which I played as Knurl and Pholde on the same bill.

NAISA, (New Adventures in Sound Art) is a non-profit organization that presents performances of electroacoustic and experimental sound art, and is located north of Toronto.
Knurl.credits:
released July 10, 2020
            
            Produced and recorded live by Alan Bloor, August 2019. 

Sounds were produced from an amplified concrete saw-blade wired with bass guitar strings.

Knurl.title: Plasmacyanin
Knurl.credits:
released January 24, 2020
                        
                    
                

                Produced and recorded live by Alan Bloor August 2019, using a car spring wired with guitar strings. Cover photo by Alan Bloor.
